value.title: Dynamic Row Level Security in Power BI with Exclude and Include Rules
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how to implement a dynamic row-level security pattern when you have a value that you want to exclude. value.title: Dynamically change the format of values in Power BI

value.title: Power BI Is Too Much for One Person   Roles in the Power BI Development
value.excerpt: Power BI is a tool that you can get started working with it in a few hours, but to use it in its full potential, these days, you require to have many skills. value.title: Power BI User Access Levels   Build and Edit are different
value.excerpt: Often I have seen Power BI users have access to the areas that they shouldn’t. In Power BI, you can share a report with a user just for view only, or give them access to view and built, or to Edit. These are all different levels of access. Build access is the one that is often is confused with Edit.

value.title: Removing the Total Value for a Column in the Table Visual of Power BI Using ISFILTERED
value.excerpt: Table visual is one of the most commonly used visuals. In Power BI, you can turn off the total row (when it won’t make sense to have the total) entirely. However, you cannot turn off the total for some columns and keep it working for the others. Using a DAX function, you can, however, do this easily.

value.title: Apply AND Logic to Multiple Selection in DAX Slicer
value.excerpt: When you apply a multiple selection to a slicer or to a filter, you obtain a logical OR condition between selected items. This video shows how to implement a logical AND condition in a measure instead of the standard OR one. Article and download: https://sql.bi/26121?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
